author: david pescovitz
text: under the hoodsmart bombs? we all know that most cutting-edge munitions don't live up to the billing, despite the fearsome price tags. at $50,000 above and beyond a typical dumb bomb, the standard laser-guided delivery systems used in the balkans conflict depend on line-of-sight, following a beam aimed from an aircraft to a target. but if the beam is obscured by clouds or fog, the bomb can go astray. that happened in april, when a not-so-smart bomb annihilated residences in the serbian town of aleksinac.lately, boeing has touted its joint direct attack munition (below, on an mk-84 warhead) as a quick-and-easy solution to such problems - a dumb-bomb upgrade. the jdam, an $18,000 guidance kit that debuted over kosovo in the spring, uses gps data and info from other onboard systems to steer the weapon. once an operator enters the coordinates into the jdam, the load can be dropped up to 15 miles from the target. if boeing's hype is to be believed, early results show that accuracy is - usually - within 30 feet.the warhead is a 2,000-pound mk-84 - what the us air force calls a "general-purpose bomb."aluminum strakes, small fins bolted around the circumference of the bomb, provide added lift and stability.a thermal battery powers both the guidance control unit and the tail actuator subsystem.the tail actuator subsystem receives messages from the mission computer, tilting three of the four control fins and maneuvering the bomb in flight. the fourth fin, a vertical stabilizer, remains fixed.the guidance control unit is the brain of the joint direct attack munition. it includes the mission computer and the inertial measurement unit. the mission computer, powered by a motorola 68040 processor, steers the smart bomb based on constantly updated coordinates from a gps receiver. the inertial measurement unit gauges the weapon's position, altitude, and velocity.must readsputterniktired/wiredgood dealas the well turnsall's well that ends wellsmarter bombbattlefield of tomorrowpass it onfashion policewhy buy retail?paranoia technologytailor-made medspeoplejargon watchpersonality typingcustomize or diesailing the red skiesgrubstake grillt1, good buddyraw data
